his Court cannot directly or indirectly assist to stop the remedial action taken by the Cabinet
of Ministers to avert serious acts of corruption taking place in the Department of Motor Traffic.
Such an action by this court would indeed negate the advancement of equal protection of law
principle enshrined in Article 12 (1) of the Constitution.
Let me conclude this judgment citing the following passage from the judgment of Her Ladyship
Justice  Shirani  Bandaranayake  (as  she  then  was)  in  the  case  of  Farook  Vs  Dharmaratne,
Chairman, Provincial Public Service Commission, Uva and others.2
